thread.title: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen take daughter Luna to lunch | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen take daughter Luna to lunch | Daily Mail Online

author: Bobbie Whiteman For Dailymail.Com
title: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen take daughter Luna to lunch | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Little Luna looked incredibly cute in a pink hooded onesie with a silver band around her head and white socks. The All Of Me crooner appeared to be equally laid back in a dark grey T-shirt, very faded blue jeans and white sneakers. Out with his girls: The 38-year-old crooner looked every inch the proud papa Yummy mummy: The 31-year-old, who has lost all the baby weight, showed off her slender physique in black athleisure wear Pretty in pink: Luna looked adorable in a onesie as Chrissy hoisted her up to her shoulder John, who turned 38 on December 28, gallantly held the car door for Chrissy when they left the restaurant. Meanwhile, the same day Chrissy shared some sweet Snapchat shots of their little girl crawling around on the wood floor of their huge living room. In three snaps John is seen playing the piano in the background as Luna shuffles towards him. Holding tight: The beautiful brunette cuddled her daughter as her handsome husband fiddled with the door of their car Sharing a smile: Both parents broke into broad grins but Luna didn't seem amused She's got her back: Chrissy held her little girl, who look lovely in a head band, close When she finally reach her dad she pulls herself into an upright position on the piano seat, before plumping back on the floor to play around his legs as her dad smiles back at the camera. The couple met in 2007 on the set of John's music video for Stereo. He proposed to the beauty in in December 2011 and they tied the knot in Como, Italy, on September 14, 2013, Helping daddy play: Chrissy also posted Snapchat images showing Luna sitting under the piano at her father's feet Interested in music: The tot seemed fascinated by the piano's pedals Getting a better view: The tot, who isn't yet walking, used the piano stool to help her stand up and get a good look at John ticking the ivories Share or comment on this article 369
